instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-0840: What is 820-0840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.1A power bounce 1 sec.. ( Works with battery BMS disconnected. )
threads.message:
This is strange......
Machine will show 5v on the USBC meter and read 0.01A for a second and reset.

When I disconnect the BMS the unit powers up and works! ( J6951 )
With the battery BMS connected it just bounces and resets.  ( I have changed the battery using a tester and get the same result! )

I diode checked <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3H_SDL</SIGNAL> / SCA and both are normal
I checked <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> it also appeared normal

History on this system.
It was serviced by another technician for screen replacement.   They changed the screen and this was the result.   The original screen is back on and does function with the same defect it had before ( lines across the bottom of the screen ) and works normally if the BMS is disconnected.

SMC?  What the heck?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.1A power bounce 1 sec.. ( Works with battery BMS disconnected. )
threads.message:
Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> exact voltage, w/ and w/o battery connected.
Did you find correct communication signals with o-scope on battery bus?
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETEDT_L</SIGNAL> stays low?

So the same board stays on (bad LCD image) with original screen assembly?
But the board doesn't turn on with new screen?

BTW, BMS is inside the battery; if you think about Battery Management System.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.1A power bounce 1 sec.. ( Works with battery BMS disconnected. )
threads.message:
The Battery was replaced temporally with a new one and the board had the same fault.   If the BMS ribbon is connected it will not post.
The fault is the same regardless if the screen is attached or not.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.1A power bounce 1 sec.. ( Works with battery BMS disconnected. )
threads.message:
Actually, machine boots with battery connected, but then gets only lines on internal screen?

What happens if you connect battery data cable, without battery power connector?
